content: sakura granny square disclaimer this pattern and photographs are the property of k a m e crochet by krisztina anna matejcsok-edomer and should be used for personal and non-commercial use you may not alter or sell this pattern in any way you may sell finished products but please credit k a m e crochet if you can thank you difficulty easy size 5 x 5 k a m e crochet designs 2019 by krisztina anna matejcsok-edomer all rights reserved materials needed  4 mm g size hook  approx 10-12 grams of any dk yarn desired  yarn needle for weaving in ends  scissors stitches used and abbreviations magic_ring = magic_ring chain = chain skip = skip st/sts= stitch/ stitches slip_stitch = slip_stitch single_crochet = single_crochet bpsc = back post single_crochet half_double_crochet = half_double_crochet bphdc = back post half_double_crochet double_crochet = double_crochet fpdc = front post double_crochet bpdc = back post double_crochet *-* =repeat pattern between these symbols special stitches front post double_crochet yarn over insert your hook from the front around the post of given stitch from right to left yarn over and finish your double_crochet as usual back post single_crochet insert your hook from the back around the post of given stitch yarn over and finish your single crochet as usual back post half_double_crochet yarn over insert your hook from the back around the post of given stitch yarn over and finish your half_double_crochet as usual back post double_crochet yarn over insert your hook from the back around the post of given stitch yarn over and finish your double_crochet as usual k a m e crochet designs 2019 by krisztina anna matejcsok-edomer all rights reserved gauge 5 half_double_crochet = 1 additional notes  us terms used throughout  each round starts with a chain 1 2 or 3 these are not counted as a stitch unless instructed otherwise to start magic_ring round 1 chain 3 double_crochet 12 into the ring join with a slip_stitch to first double_crochet not chain 3 12 double_crochet round 2 chain 2 1 double_crochet in same st fpdc around the chain 3 from previous round and the same st you just put a double_crochet into *1dc in next st fpdc around the same st* repeat *to* to end join with a slip_stitch to first double_crochet 12 fpdc 12 double_crochet round 3 chain 2 1 double_crochet in same st 1 double_crochet in next st that s the first fpdc from previous round fpdc around the same st you just put a double_crochet into *1 double_crochet in next 2 sts note the 2nd st is always the fpdc fpdc around fpdc* repeat *to* to end join with a slip_stitch to first double_crochet 12 fpdc 24 double_crochet round 4 slip_stitch to first fpdc from prevoius round chain 1 single_crochet in same st skip 2 sts those are the 2 double_crochet from prev round 7 double_crochet in next fpdc *skip 2 sts single_crochet in next fpdc skip 2 sts 7 double_crochet in next fpdc* repeat *to* to
